channel.title: Please Help Me to Understand
channel.description:
Hello everyone!
[size=14pt][b][u]Who Am I?[/u][/b][/size]
Let me start off by saying I registered on "July 19, 2010, 01:12:20 PM" and have been on and off with Moparscape over the years.
I recently graduated from a vocational highschool taking Computer Programming for four years. I have been doing HTML, PHP, MySQL, VB.NET, C# and C++, Actionscript and many more over this period of time. I really enjoy programming and I am [u][b]NOT[/b][/u] here looking to be "spoon fed"!!!
I like the 317 pk / command based servers. So I downloaded a [u]DeltaScape[/u] base. It was ok. I removed the Anti leech, but it didn't feel right. There was too much "junk" in the client.java and other files. I downloaded a cleaned DeltaScape from Tatemo. If anyone knows of him, please help me out here :).
Yes, I have read multiple tutorials on 317's and I know what I'm doing, code wise. I just can't get a grip of what's happening in the files or folders.
[b][size=14pt]What I Need:[/size][/b]
[ul][li]Help on Understanding what each .java file does[/li] [li]If I want to do something, where can I put it - which function or which .java file[/li] [li]To make working pk/command based 317 server[/li][/ul]
This cleaned DeltaScape is making me VERY confused. It has this type of file hierarchy:
[ul][li]DeltaScape Cleaned Parent Folder[/li] [list] [li]Bin folder[/li] [li]Server folder[/li] [list] [li]Player folder[/li] [list] [li]more folders[/li] [li]Client/Player/PlayerHandler.java files[/li] [/list] [li]World folder[/li] [list] [li]more folders[/li] [li]process.java[/li] [/list] [li]GameEngine.java[/li] [/list] [li]Compiler[/li] [li]Run[/li] [/list][/ul]
[size=12pt]Honestly I just don't know where to start!!! It is very clean. I want to make it playable from start to finish. If I could get some support from the community I would really appreciate it! Thanks, Maizez[/size]

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

Either that, or you can hit me up a PM if you would like.

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Maizez Maizez
item.description:
@Maizez wrote:

Thanks!

I’ll give it a read. If I have any questions, I’ll just come back here and make a reply?

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

[quote=“Maizez, post:11, topic:444478”]I would rep++ you if I could.

Never messed with packets in my life… Where can I get started?[/quote]It’s okay, rep doesn’t mean anything. And to start, you could always read up on the 317 protocol.

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Maizez Maizez
item.description:
@Maizez wrote:

I would rep++ you if I could.

Never messed with packets in my life… Where can I get started?

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

I think he removed all that. What you can do, is print the packet to the console when you click a button. You can write some code to make it print the button id and stuff. But when you click a button, it won’t do anything because he removed it when he cleaned the source.

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Maizez Maizez
item.description:
@Maizez wrote:

Thanks just saying that makes things easier. One question though. Will I be able to see the ID of the object I’m clicking? Also I believe this server doesn’t even handle button clicking (nothing happens when I click a bank booth for example…)

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

[quote=“Maizez, post:7, topic:444478”][quote author=Onix link=topic=547167.msg4011390#msg4011390 date=1339260115]
Well you can add the teleport function anywhere in the file that isn’t in another method, otherwise that method would have to be called for the teleport method to work.

For the case, you will need to use a switch statement:

switch (buttonId) { case 50235: //Teleport home. break; }
[/quote]

Great! Now the next step which I got stuck on is to figure out where exactly that block of code goes.
I remember it would go in clickingMost.java
But I don’t see the equivalent of that in this source.[/quote]Just look for when the server handles button clicking, it could be in any class that relates to packets being sent from the server to the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Maizez Maizez
item.description:
@Maizez wrote:

[quote=“Onix, post:6, topic:444478”]Well you can add the teleport function anywhere in the file that isn’t in another method, otherwise that method would have to be called for the teleport method to work.

For the case, you will need to use a switch statement:

switch (buttonId) { case 50235: //Teleport home. break; }[/quote]

Great! Now the next step which I got stuck on is to figure out where exactly that block of code goes.
I remember it would go in clickingMost.java
But I don’t see the equivalent of that in this source.

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

Well you can add the teleport function anywhere in the file that isn’t in another method, otherwise that method would have to be called for the teleport method to work.

For the case, you will need to use a switch statement:

switch (buttonId) { case 50235: //Teleport home. break; }

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Maizez Maizez
item.description:
@Maizez wrote:

Things are just a bit overwhelming right now since I’m just getting refreshed in Java.

I go in to make a change. This server doesn’t even have teleportation, so I go into the client to add the private void teleport() {} function but like I really don’t understand where I can add it and later where to go to add “case 50235:” (home teleport).

Everything is not clicking for me yet…

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

[quote=“Maizez, post:3, topic:444478”][quote author=Onix link=topic=547167.msg4011381#msg4011381 date=1339259317]
Well, to learn what each class files does, you will need to open the file with a notepad, or even the source with an IDE, such as Eclipse or Netbeans. Then you will need to read the code line by line and use common sense to figure out what each class is doing. Another big help for understanding is the naming conventions of the classes, such as the ‘player’ classes, which handle player related stuff.
[/quote]

Thanks for the reply, Onix.

I do have both Eclipse and Netbeans. Let me clarify that I do understand both the naming conventions and most of the code in each file.
When it comes down to doing my own code I just can’t seem to figure it out.[/quote]Figure out things, such as what for example?

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Maizez Maizez
item.description:
@Maizez wrote:

Onix:

Well, to learn what each class files does, you will need to open the file with a notepad, or even the source with an IDE, such as Eclipse or Netbeans. Then you will need to read the code line by line and use common sense to figure out what each class is doing. Another big help for understanding is the naming conventions of the classes, such as the ‘player’ classes, which handle player related stuff.

Thanks for the reply, Onix.

I do have both Eclipse and Netbeans. Let me clarify that I do understand both the naming conventions and most of the code in each file.
When it comes down to doing my own code I just can’t seem to figure it out.

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

Well, to learn what each class files does, you will need to open the file with a notepad, or even the source with an IDE, such as Eclipse or Netbeans. Then you will need to read the code line by line and use common sense to figure out what each class is doing. Another big help for understanding is the naming conventions of the classes, such as the ‘player’ classes, which handle player related stuff.

To figure out where to put something, also relies on common sense. If you want to make clicking an object do something, you will need to know where that packet is handled, this can be done by reading through the files from the first part of this post. Some servers even have individual classes for this, such as ‘ObjectHandler’.

Read full topic

item.title: Please Help Me to Understand
item.dc:creator: @Maizez Maizez
item.description:
@Maizez wrote:

Hello everyone!

[size=14pt]Who Am I?[/size]

Let me start off by saying I registered on “July 19, 2010, 01:12:20 PM” and have been on and off with Moparscape over the years.

I recently graduated from a vocational highschool taking Computer Programming for four years. I have been doing HTML, PHP, MySQL, VB.NET, C# and C++, Actionscript and many more over this period of time. I really enjoy programming and I am NOT here looking to be “spoon fed”!!!

I like the 317 pk / command based servers. So I downloaded a DeltaScape base. It was ok. I removed the Anti leech, but it didn’t feel right. There was too much “junk” in the client.java and other files. I downloaded a cleaned DeltaScape from Tatemo. If anyone knows of him, please help me out here :).

Yes, I have read multiple tutorials on 317’s and I know what I’m doing, code wise. I just can’t get a grip of what’s happening in the files or folders.

[size=14pt]What I Need:[/size]

[ul][li]Help on Understanding what each .java file does[/li]
[li]If I want to do something, where can I put it - which function or which .java file[/li]
[li]To make working pk/command based 317 server[/li][/ul]

This cleaned DeltaScape is making me VERY confused. It has this type of file hierarchy:

[ul][li]DeltaScape Cleaned Parent Folder[/li]
[list]
[li]Bin folder[/li]
[li]Server folder[/li]
[list]
[li]Player folder[/li]
[list]
[li]more folders[/li]
[li]Client/Player/PlayerHandler.java files[/li]
[/list]
[li]World folder[/li]
[list]
[li]more folders[/li]
[li]process.java[/li]
[/list]
[li]GameEngine.java[/li]
[/list]
[li]Compiler[/li]
[li]Run[/li]
[/list][/ul]

[size=12pt]Honestly I just don’t know where to start!!! It is very clean. I want to make it playable from start to finish. If I could get some support from the community I would really appreciate it!
Thanks,
Maizez[/size]

Read full topic
